Geometry¶

class Geometry

The master class containing references to all geometry-related objects (surfaces, cells, universes and lattices) and materials.

The primary purpose for the geometry is to serve as a collection of all geometry-related objects, as well as for ray tracing of characteristic tracks across the geometry and computing flat source region - to - cell maps.

Public Functions

Geometry()

Constructor initializes an empty geometry.

~Geometry()

Destructor clears all references to materials, surfaces, cells, universes and lattices.

double getWidth()

Returns the total width (x extent) of the geometry in cm.

Return
the total width of the geometry (cm)

double getHeight()

Returns the total height (y extent) of the geometry in cm.

Return
the total height of the geometry (cm)

double getXMin()

Return the minimum x-coordinate contained by the geometry.

Return
the minimum x-coordinate (cm)

double getXMax()

Return the maximum x-coordinate contained by the geometry.

Return
the maximum x-coordinate (cm)

double getYMin()

Return the minimum y-coordinate contained by the geometry.

Return
the minimum y-coordinate (cm)

double getYMax()

Return the maximum y-coordinate contained by the geometry.

Return
the maximum y-coordinate (cm)

bool getBCTop()

Returns the boundary condition for the top surface of the geometry.

The boundary conditions are vacuum (false) and reflective (false).

Return
the boundary conditions for the top of the geometry

bool getBCBottom()

Returns the boundary condition for the bottom surface of the geometry.

The boundary conditions are vacuum (false) and reflective (false).

Return
the boundary conditions for the bottom of the geometry

bool getBCLeft()

Returns the boundary condition for the left surface of the geometry.

The boundary conditions are vacuum (false) and reflective (false).

Return
the boundary conditions for the left surface of the geometry

bool getBCRight()

Returns the boundary condition for the right surface of the geometry.

The boundary conditions are vacuum (false) and reflective (false).

Return
the boundary conditions for the right surface of the geometry

int getNumFSRs()

Returns the number of flat source regions in the geometry.

Return
number of flat source regions

int getNumEnergyGroups()

Returns the number of energy groups for each material’s nuclear data.

Return
the number of energy groups

int getNumMaterials()

Returns the number of materials in the geometry.

Return
the number of materials

int * getFSRtoCellMap()

Return an array indexed by flat source region IDs which contain the corresponding cell IDs.

Return
an array map of flat source region to cell IDs

int * getFSRtoMaterialMap()

Return an array indexed by flat source region IDs which contain the corresponding material IDs.

Return
an array map of flat source region to material IDs

double getMaxSegmentLength()

Return the maximum segment length computed during segmentation (cm)

Return
max segment length (cm)

double getMinSegmentLength()

Return the minimum segment length computed during segmentation (cm)

Return
min segment length (cm)

Return the map container of pointers to materials stored with their ids as keys

Return

Add a material to the geometry.

Parameters

    a pointer to a material object

Add a surface to the geometry.

Parameters

    a pointer to the surface object

void addCell(Cell * cell)

Add a cell to the geometry.

This method checks if the universe the cell is in already exists if not, it creates one and adds it to the geometry.

Parameters
  • cell -

    a pointer to the cell object

void addUniverse(Universe * universe)

Add a universe to the geometry.

Parameters
  • universe -

    a pointer to the universe object

void addLattice(Lattice * lattice)

Add a lattice to the geometry.

Adds the lattice to both the lattice and universe containers.

Parameters
  • lattice -

    a pointer to the lattice object

Cell * findCellContainingCoords(LocalCoords * coords)

Find the cell that this localcoords object is in.

This method assumes that the localcoords has coordinates and a universe id. The method will recursively find the localcoords by building a linked list of localcoords from the localcoord passed in as an argument down to the lowest level cell found. In the process it will set the local coordinates for each localcoord in the linked list for the lattice or universe that it is in. If the localcoords is outside the bounds of the geometry or on the boundaries this method will return NULL; otherwise it will return a pointer to the cell that the localcoords is currently in.

Return
returns a pointer to a cell if found, NULL if no cell found
Parameters
  • coords -

    pointer to a localcoords object

CellBasic * findCellContainingFSR(int fsr_id)

Find the cell for a flat source region ID.

This function calls the recursive function findCell with a pointer to the base level universe 0

Return
a pointer to the cell that this fsr is in
Parameters
  • fsr_id -

    a flat source region id

Cell * findCell(Universe * univ, int fsr_id)

Find the cell for an fsr_id at a certain universe level.

This is a recursive function which is intended to be called with the base universe 0 and a flat source region ID. It will recursively call itself until it reaches the cell which corresponds to this flat source region.

Return
a pointer to the cell that this flat source region is in
Parameters
  • univ -

    a universe pointer for this flat source region’s universe level

  • fsr_id -

    a flat source region id

int findFSRId(LocalCoords * coords)

Find and return the ID of the flat source region that this localcoords object resides within.

Parameters
  • coords -

    a localcoords object returned

void subdivideCells()

Subidivides all cells in the geometry into rings and angular sectors.

void initializeFlatSourceRegions()

Compute the number of flat source regions and nitialize an array of FSRs and FSR maps.

void segmentize(Track * track)

This method creates segments within flat source regions in the geometry for a given track.

This method starts at the beginning of the track and finds successive intersection points with flat source regions as the track passes through the geometry and creates segment structs and adds them to the track.

Parameters
  • track -

    a pointer to a track to segmentize

void computePinPowers(FP_PRECISION * FSRs_to_powers, FP_PRECISION * FSRs_to_pin_powers)

This method is called from the Solver after fixed source iteration to compute the powers (fission rates) for each lattice cell.

This method computes both pin and assembly powers stored in arrays mapped by FSR ID in the second parameter, FSRs_to_pin_powers

Parameters
  • FSRs_to_powers -

    an array of the fission rate inside a given FSR

  • FSRs_to_pin_powers -

    an array of the fission rate of the lattice cell this FSR is within

FP_PRECISION computePinPowersInUniverse(Universe * univ, char * output_file_prefix, int FSR_id, FP_PRECISION * FSRs_to_powers, FP_PRECISION * FSRs_to_pin_powers)

This is a recursive function which computes the powers of all of the FSRs inside a given universe.

This function handles both lattices and regular type universes and saves the powers computed for each lattice cell in a file.

Parameters
  • univ -

    a pointer to the universe of interest

  • output_file_prefix -

    the prefix for the output file to save the powers

  • FSR_id -

    the FSR ID prefix from the previous level’s FSR map

  • FSRs_to_powers -

    array of the fission rates for each FSR

  • FSRs_to_pin_powers -

    array of the fission rates for the lattice cell that each FSR is within

std::string toString()

Converts this geometry’s attributes to a character array.

Return
a character array of this geometry’s attributes

void printString()

Prints a string representation of all of the geometry’s objects to the console.
